# C3 Context: Acme Platform

## System Overview

**Acme Platform** is an e-commerce platform built as a Turborepo monorepo. The system provides online storefront capabilities for product browsing and order management.

## System Boundary

```
+------------------------------------------+
|           Acme Platform                   |
|  +-------------+    +------------------+  |
|  | Web Store   |--->| API Server       |  |
|  | (Next.js)   |    | (Hono)           |  |
|  +-------------+    +--------+---------+  |
|                              |            |
|                     +--------v---------+  |
|                     | Database         |  |
|                     | (Prisma-style)   |  |
|                     +------------------+  |
+------------------------------------------+
              ^
              |
        +-----+-----+
        | Customer  |
        | (Browser) |
        +-----------+
```

## Primary Actors

| Actor | Description | Interaction |
|-------|-------------|-------------|
| Customer | End user browsing products | Accesses web storefront via browser |

## External Dependencies

| System | Type | Purpose |
|--------|------|---------|
| Database | Persistence | Product catalog and order storage |

## Technology Stack

- **Build System**: Turborepo v2.x
- **Runtime**: Bun
- **Language**: TypeScript 5.x
- **Package Manager**: Workspace-based (pnpm/npm/bun)

## Container Index

| ID | Container | Path | Technology |
|----|-----------|------|------------|
| c3-web | Web Storefront | `apps/web/` | Next.js 14 |
| c3-api | API Server | `apps/api/` | Hono 4 |
| c3-ui | UI Components | `packages/ui/` | React 18 |
| c3-api-client | API Client | `packages/api-client/` | TypeScript |
| c3-database | Database Client | `packages/database/` | TypeScript |

# C3 Container: Web Storefront (c3-web)

## Overview

The customer-facing web application built with Next.js 14. Provides product browsing and shopping functionality.

## Container Metadata

| Property | Value |
|----------|-------|
| **ID** | c3-web |
| **Path** | `apps/web/` |
| **Technology** | Next.js 14, React 18 |
| **Package** | `@acme/web` |

## Dependencies

| Dependency | Type | Purpose |
|------------|------|---------|
| @acme/ui | Internal | Shared UI components |
| @acme/api-client | Internal | API communication layer |
| next | External | React framework |
| react | External | UI library |

## Component Structure

```
apps/web/
├── package.json
└── src/
    └── app/
        ├── layout.tsx    # Root layout wrapper
        └── page.tsx      # Home page with product grid
```

## Component Index

| ID | Component | Path | Responsibility |
|----|-----------|------|----------------|
| c3-web-layout | Root Layout | `src/app/layout.tsx` | HTML shell and app wrapper |
| c3-web-home | Home Page | `src/app/page.tsx` | Product listing page |

## Data Flow

```
[Customer Browser]
       |
       v
[Next.js App Router]
       |
       v
[@acme/api-client] --> [API Server (c3-api)]
       |
       v
[@acme/ui components]
       |
       v
[Rendered HTML]
```

## Key Behaviors

1. **Product Listing**: Fetches products from API on server-side and renders grid
2. **Add to Cart**: Button triggers cart addition (UI component from @acme/ui)

## Scripts

| Command | Purpose |
|---------|---------|
| `dev` | Start development server |
| `build` | Production build |

# C3 Container: API Server (c3-api)

## Overview

REST API server built with Hono framework. Provides product catalog and order management endpoints.

## Container Metadata

| Property | Value |
|----------|-------|
| **ID** | c3-api |
| **Path** | `apps/api/` |
| **Technology** | Hono 4, Bun |
| **Package** | `@acme/api` |

## Dependencies

| Dependency | Type | Purpose |
|------------|------|---------|
| @acme/database | Internal | Database access layer |
| hono | External | Web framework |

## Component Structure

```
apps/api/
├── package.json
└── src/
    └── index.ts    # Main application entry
```

## API Endpoints

| Method | Path | Handler | Description |
|--------|------|---------|-------------|
| GET | `/products` | `app.get("/products", ...)` | List all products |
| GET | `/products/:id` | `app.get("/products/:id", ...)` | Get product by ID |
| POST | `/orders` | `app.post("/orders", ...)` | Create new order |

## Middleware

| Middleware | Scope | Purpose |
|------------|-------|---------|
| CORS | `/*` | Enable cross-origin requests |

## Data Flow

```
[HTTP Request]
       |
       v
[Hono Router]
       |
       v
[Route Handler]
       |
       v
[@acme/database] --> [Database]
       |
       v
[JSON Response]
```

## Key Behaviors

1. **Product Queries**: Fetches from database via `db.product` methods
2. **Order Creation**: Accepts items array, persists via `db.order.create`

## Scripts

| Command | Purpose |
|---------|---------|
| `dev` | Start dev server with hot reload (`bun --watch`) |
| `build` | Bundle for production |

# C3 Container: UI Components (c3-ui)

## Overview

Shared React component library providing reusable UI primitives for the platform.

## Container Metadata

| Property | Value |
|----------|-------|
| **ID** | c3-ui |
| **Path** | `packages/ui/` |
| **Technology** | React 18 |
| **Package** | `@acme/ui` |

## Dependencies

| Dependency | Type | Purpose |
|------------|------|---------|
| react | Peer | UI library (provided by consumer) |

## Component Structure

```
packages/ui/
├── package.json
└── src/
    ├── index.ts      # Barrel export
    ├── button.tsx    # Button component
    ├── card.tsx      # Card component
    └── input.tsx     # Input component
```

## Component Index

| ID | Component | Path | Props | Description |
|----|-----------|------|-------|-------------|
| c3-ui-button | Button | `src/button.tsx` | `children`, `variant`, `onClick` | Clickable button with variants |
| c3-ui-card | Card | `src/card.tsx` | `children`, `title` | Container card with optional title |
| c3-ui-input | Input | `src/input.tsx` | `placeholder`, `type`, `value`, `onChange` | Text input field |

## Component Details

### Button (c3-ui-button)

```typescript
interface ButtonProps {
  children: ReactNode;
  variant?: "primary" | "secondary";
  onClick?: () => void;
}
```

**CSS Classes**: `btn btn-${variant}`

### Card (c3-ui-card)

```typescript
interface CardProps {
  children: ReactNode;
  title?: string;
}
```

**CSS Classes**: `card`

### Input (c3-ui-input)

```typescript
interface InputProps {
  placeholder?: string;
  type?: "text" | "email" | "password";
  value?: string;
  onChange?: (value: string) => void;
}
```

**CSS Classes**: `input`

## Usage Pattern

```typescript
import { Button, Card, Input } from "@acme/ui";

// Components are imported via barrel export from index.ts
```

## Consumers

- `@acme/web` - Web storefront application

# C3 Container: API Client (c3-api-client)

## Overview

TypeScript client library for communicating with the Acme API server. Provides typed methods for product and order operations.

## Container Metadata

| Property | Value |
|----------|-------|
| **ID** | c3-api-client |
| **Path** | `packages/api-client/` |
| **Technology** | TypeScript, Fetch API |
| **Package** | `@acme/api-client` |

## Dependencies

None (uses native Fetch API)

## Component Structure

```
packages/api-client/
├── package.json
└── src/
    └── index.ts    # API client implementation
```

## Configuration

| Variable | Default | Description |
|----------|---------|-------------|
| `API_URL` | `http://localhost:3001` | Base URL for API requests |

## API Methods

### Products

| Method | Signature | Endpoint | Description |
|--------|-----------|----------|-------------|
| `list` | `api.products.list()` | `GET /products` | Fetch all products |
| `get` | `api.products.get(id)` | `GET /products/:id` | Fetch product by ID |

### Orders

| Method | Signature | Endpoint | Description |
|--------|-----------|----------|-------------|
| `create` | `api.orders.create(items)` | `POST /orders` | Create new order |

## Type Definitions

```typescript
// Order item structure
interface OrderItem {
  productId: string;
  quantity: number;
}

// API methods
api.products.list(): Promise<Product[]>
api.products.get(id: string): Promise<Product>
api.orders.create(items: OrderItem[]): Promise<Order>
```

## Usage Pattern

```typescript
import { api } from "@acme/api-client";

// List products
const products = await api.products.list();

// Get single product
const product = await api.products.get("123");

// Create order
const order = await api.orders.create([
  { productId: "1", quantity: 2 }
]);
```

## Consumers

- `@acme/web` - Web storefront application

| [c3-api-client.md](./c3-api-client.md) | API Client Library |
| [c3-database.md](./c3-database.md) | Database Access Layer |

## Architecture Overview

```
┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                      Acme Platform                          │
│                                                             │
│  ┌──────────────┐        ┌──────────────┐                   │
│  │   @acme/web  │───────▶│   @acme/api  │                   │
│  │   (Next.js)  │        │   (Hono)     │                   │
│  └──────┬───────┘        └──────┬───────┘                   │
│         │                       │                           │
│         │                       ▼                           │
│         │               ┌──────────────┐                    │
│         │               │@acme/database│                    │
│         │               └──────────────┘                    │
│         │                                                   │
│         ▼                                                   │
│  ┌──────────────┐  ┌─────────────────┐                      │
│  │   @acme/ui   │  │ @acme/api-client│                      │
│  │  (React)     │  │   (Fetch)       │                      │
│  └──────────────┘  └─────────────────┘                      │
│                                                             │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
```

## Dependency Graph

```
@acme/web
├── @acme/ui (internal)

@acme/api
└── @acme/database (internal)

3. **Find Components**: Component tables within containers list specific modules
4. **Trace Dependencies**: Use dependency tables to understand relationships

## Updating This Documentation

When making architectural changes:

1. Update relevant container documentation
2. Add/remove components from component indexes
3. Update dependency tables if imports change
4. Keep API endpoint tables in sync with code
